availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Johnson (Nelson County, Kentucky, attorney and state representative)

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Nelson County native. Son of William Johnson. Married to Nannie Crow Johnson in 1855. Father of Eliza Johnson, William Johnson, Ben Johnson, Lila Johnson, and Robert Johnson. Store merchant with Charles McManus until 1840. Studied law with Ben Hardin. Admitted to the bar in 1849. County attorney in Nelson County from 1851 to 1862. Owned eighteen enslaved persons in 1860. Served as representative for the 14th District in the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1865.
